instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
properly working w/o battery
i changed bios,charging ic (U7100) & new battery but found same issue 

i attached Machine-check-capabilities

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
You didn't specify if machine starts with battery alone (no charger).
Also good to know exact PPBUS_G3H voltage without battery (only charger connected).
Just in case, change Q7155.

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
With battery,irrespective of adpter, machine is restarting in loop,
the machine works fine on adapter without battery ( no restarting issue)

PPBUS_G3H 12.40v

Q7155 after changing same condition

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H 12.40v"
Did you check it at F7140/41?
Be aware, pin 1 of L7130 is not proper test point for PPBUS_G3H.

Check resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of U7100.
Also check voltage and diode mode to ground on SCL/SDA lines of battery bus.

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
yes[B] F7140/41[/B] good fuse

[B]L7130[/B]  pin 2 volt-12.60v ( PPBUS_G3H )

[B]U7100[/B] pin 17/18 -3.4ohms

             pin 27/28  -21.6ohms

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
12.6V is the expected voltage; you might got 12.4V at incorrect test point.
That's the reason of above explanation.

Post SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE and SMC_DCIN_ISENSE levels, with both charger and battery connected.
Also check if machine stays on (no restart) in SMC bypass mode.

Did you test with known good battery?
Keep in mind "new" (chinese, or not), is not the same as known good!

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message: is the lap performance[B] reduce[/B] without battery?

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
threads.message:
Could be; not al machines have the same behavior however.
MacOS adjusts CPU clock and other power related performances, depending on battery presence.

We have reported on the forum tons of weird issues caused by incorrect battery.
So known good battery is a "must test".

threads.title: 820-3662-a automatically restart while i connected battery
